title: How Many Episodes of Dune: Prophecy Are Left?
description: Viewers are buzzing with anticipation about how many episodes of Dune: Prophecy are yet to air. This captivating sci-fi series serves as a prequel to Denis Villeneuve’s Dune movies. It centers on two Harkonnen sisters, who bravely face the dangers that jeopardize humanity’s future. So, when can fans expect the grand finale of Dune: Prophecy […] The post How Many Episodes of Dune: Prophecy Are Left? appeared first on ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More.
author: Ayesha Zafar
excerpt: Viewers of Dune: Prophecy are curious about how many episodes it has as well as the finale's release date. Read on to learn all the details.
siteName: ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More
text: Viewers are buzzing with anticipation about how many episodes of Dune: Prophecy are yet to air. This captivating sci-fi series serves as a prequel to Denis Villeneuve’s Dune movies. It centers on two Harkonnen sisters, who bravely face the dangers that jeopardize humanity’s future. So, when can fans expect the grand finale of Dune: Prophecy to debut on HBO and Max? Here’s the most recent information regarding the episode count for Dune: Prophecy and their release schedule. How many episodes of Dune: Prophecy will come out after Episode 1? Dune: Prophecy is left with five more episodes after Episode 1. Season 1 of Dune: Prophecy recently premiered on November 17, 2024, at 9 PM ET and 6 PM PT. The first season’s storyline spans six episodes, leaving five yet to air after the first one. Titled ‘The Hidden Hand,’ the debut episode received a decent response from both viewers and critics alike. Dune: Prophecy Episode 1 highlights how Valya Harkonnen on Wallach IX made a promise to Mother Superior Raquella to safeguard the Sisterhood by placing one of their own on the Imperial Throne. Fast forward thirty years and Valya is now confronted with a challenge to her long-held ambitions. When will Dune: Prophecy’s finale stream? Dune: Prophecy Season 1’s finale will stream on Sunday, December 22, 2024. The sixth and final episode is expected to resolve the season’s compelling and intense narratives, generating excitement among fans for future developments. The show illustrates the beginnings of a Harkonnen sisterhood shrouded in secrecy, that serves as the foundation of the Bene Gesserit. They position one of its members on the imperial throne. Set within the Dune universe, the narrative takes place 10,000 years before Paul Atreides’ ascension to power. The cast features Josh Heuston, Emily Watson, Travis Fimmel, Jodhi May, Olivia Williams, Mark Strong, Sarah-Sofie Boussnina, and many others. Meanwhile, viewers can watch new episodes of Dune: Prophecy Season 1 every Sunday on HBO and Max.
html:
Viewers are buzzing with anticipation about how many episodes of Dune: Prophecy are yet to air. This captivating sci-fi series serves as a prequel to Denis Villeneuve’s Dune movies. It centers on two Harkonnen sisters, who bravely face the dangers that jeopardize humanity’s future. So, when can fans expect the grand finale of Dune: Prophecy to debut on HBO and Max?

Here’s the most recent information regarding the episode count for Dune: Prophecy and their release schedule.

How many episodes of Dune: Prophecy will come out after Episode 1?

Dune: Prophecy is left with five more episodes after Episode 1.

Season 1 of Dune: Prophecy recently premiered on November 17, 2024, at 9 PM ET and 6 PM PT. The first season’s storyline spans six episodes, leaving five yet to air after the first one. Titled ‘The Hidden Hand,’ the debut episode received a decent response from both viewers and critics alike.

Dune: Prophecy Episode 1 highlights how Valya Harkonnen on Wallach IX made a promise to Mother Superior Raquella to safeguard the Sisterhood by placing one of their own on the Imperial Throne. Fast forward thirty years and Valya is now confronted with a challenge to her long-held ambitions.

When will Dune: Prophecy’s finale stream?

Dune: Prophecy Season 1’s finale will stream on Sunday, December 22, 2024.

The sixth and final episode is expected to resolve the season’s compelling and intense narratives, generating excitement among fans for future developments. The show illustrates the beginnings of a Harkonnen sisterhood shrouded in secrecy, that serves as the foundation of the Bene Gesserit. They position one of its members on the imperial throne. Set within the Dune universe, the narrative takes place 10,000 years before Paul Atreides’ ascension to power.

The cast features Josh Heuston, Emily Watson, Travis Fimmel, Jodhi May, Olivia Williams, Mark Strong, Sarah-Sofie Boussnina, and many others.

Meanwhile, viewers can watch new episodes of Dune: Prophecy Season 1 every Sunday on HBO and Max.
